022import org.apache.turbine.annotation.AnnotationProcessor;
023import org.apache.turbine.util.TurbineException;
024
025/**
026 * <p>This class provides a <code>Service</code> implementation that
027 * Services used in Turbine are required to extend. 
028 * This class provides the ability to process field and method annotations {@link TurbineServices} in a Turbine service.
029 * You could also enable scanning globally by annotating the class (service) with the annotation {@link TurbineServices}, 
030 * then method annotation could be omitted, if the argument class is {@link TurbineServices} annotated.  
031 * </p>
032 *
033 */
034public abstract class MethodAnnotatedTurbineBaseService
035        extends TurbineBaseService
036{
037    
038    /**
039     * Performs late initialization.
040     *
041     * If your class relies on early initialization, and the object it
042     * expects was not received, you can use late initialization to
043     * throw an exception and complain.
044     *
045     * @throws InitializationException if initialization of this
046     * class was not successful.
047     */
048    @Override
049    public void init() throws InitializationException
050    {
051        setInit(true);
052        try {
053            // if second parameter is true, we get into an endless loop if setInit is done last
054            AnnotationProcessor.process(this, true);
055        } catch (TurbineException e) {
056            throw new InitializationException(e.getMessage(), e);
057        }
058    }
059}
